author: mystic
text: so i have this panville idea for mermay. should i write it?

author: mystic
text: She felt his fingers under her chin as he tilted her head up. Their eyes met and all her fears melted away. He may have been rumoured to be a ruthless man, but his eyes showed her the truth. She was safe.

author: mystic
text:
“Your hand, my lady.” His voice was low and it sent shivers down her spine. 
She took his hand and he helped her stand. She watched as his hands gathered her veil. He pushed it over her head, revealing her face. There were whispers from the people as they saw her.

author: mystic
text:
She felt him leave her side and she now stood on her own in front of curious eyes. She curtsied low.
“My lord.” She said as loud as she could.
The room was silent as the people heard the footsteps of their king. Pansy could feel him getting closer. He held out his hand to her.

author: mystic
text:
He was broad shouldered and tall. She could see the outline of his long legs and his strong arms.
“My dear friend, I present my daughter, Pansy Lilliana Parkinson.” She heard her father’s voice. Her father squeezed her hand.

author: mystic
text: Pansy kept her head down as she held onto her father’s arm. She could feel the eyes of the court on her. She steadied her breathing as they reached the bottom of the steps. She still couldn’t see much through her veil but she saw the outline of the man she was to marry.

author: mystic
text:
She was adorned with emeralds and her face was covered by a beautiful veil she could barely see out of. They waited for the doors to open.
“Lady Pansy Parkinson, presented by her father, the honourable Lord Phillip Parkinson.”

author: mystic
text: So Pansy put on her brave face that day as she was to be presented. Her mother and her ladies dressed her in a luxurious green garment that enhanced her natural curvature. It was rumoured to be his favourite colour.

author: mystic
text: She had been betrothed to him, a man twice her age, from the moment she was born. Her father had guaranteed it. She was fearful to marry him, a man she only knew stories of, but for the sake of her family she would.

author: mystic
text: And all the other ladies had swooned over his apparent handsomeness. It was also rumoured that he had quite the reputation. She didn’t know how she felt about that information.

author: mystic
text: Pansy knew all about Lord Neville before she even arrived in the kingdom. Her father told her all the stories of a brave king who had slain even the most lecherous and devilish men. Some of her ladies even said that he was a lecherous and devilish man himself. https://t.co/fpuPXyAjNO
